intro: Oldenlandia praecox, commonly known as the early oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woods. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. The flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by insects, contributing to its role in pollination ecosystems.
